and it was amazing, but like
any project of this sort,

18.47.text:
So material design
is really good

20.29.text:
for apps but sites are a

23.39.text:
because it doesn't have
much to say about those.

25.39.text:
I had to step in, kind of

28.26.text:

So I'm looking at the

31.96.text:
I'm looking at the

33.40.text:

35.37.text:

And in the end, I

47.00.text:
When I got to
building the site, I

48.81.text:
knew that the animations
of these card takeovers

51.21.text:
were going to be really hard
to do at 60 frames a second.

54.17.text:
So I ended up coming up
with a new way of doing it.

56.63.text:
And that way was to take the
first position of the card

59.46.text:
and the last
position of the card

61.59.text:
and then using transform
and opacity changes

63.76.text:
to reverse the end
position back to the start.

68.64.text:
But then when you switch
on transitions on transform

70.88.text:
and opacity and you
let it play forward,

73.20.text:
it plays cheaply because
these are just done by the GPU

77.15.text:
I call it FLIP because it's
first, last, invert, play.

80.67.text:
And it was the way
that we got from hey,

82.63.text:
this is not going to run at
60 frames a second to yes,

85.24.text:
this pretty much does run at 60
frames a second and that for me

Service worker there

And those three things

The all new and ready sort

I love sharing the process that

It's always about build
